content:
• Friday, July 6, 2012
  • STX

    While Seagate (STX -0.5%) and Western Digital (WDC +1.1%) outperformed following Seagate's...

    While Seagate (STX -0.5%) and Western Digital (WDC +1.1%) outperformed following Seagate's warning, hard drive controller chip supplier LSI (LSI-OLD -5.3%) had a rough day. Seagate's remarks about a "supplier quality issue" affecting enterprise hard drive shipments might be worrying investors. Raymond James' Hans Mosesmann is defending LSI, arguing Seagate's 9% Q/Q shipment growth suggests LSI will be able to meet Q2 and Q3 estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • CHK

    While natural gas futures sold off today (like many other commodities), Henry Hub gas spot...

    While natural gas futures sold off today (like many other commodities), Henry Hub gas spot prices rose 1%. That helped some natural gas names rally on a down day. CHK +2%. APL +1.8%. OKS +1.2%. EROC +1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 4 Comments
  • PWRD

    Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD) spikes briefly after the close as Fosun International reports 8.31%...

    Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD) spikes briefly after the close as Fosun International reports 8.31% stake in the company, The firm adds that it may engage in communications with other shareholders and the board with regard to the business operations of the company and strategies for enhancing shareholder value.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • SIRI

    Shares of Sirius XM Radio (SIRI -2.2%) give back a bit of the gains they churned up after June...

    Shares of Sirius XM Radio (SIRI -2.2%) give back a bit of the gains they churned up after June automobile sales came in strong. While steady demand is crucial for the company, it's also only one part of the equation as conversion rates still need to be maintained to keep sales projections on track.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • EQNR

    Statoil (STO -2.7%) leads oil shares lower after the state-run Norwegian oil firm said it's...

    Statoil (STO -2.7%) leads oil shares lower after the state-run Norwegian oil firm said it's planning to cut output by 1.2M barrels of oil a day as part of a lockout on collective bargaining units.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • AVL

    Shares of Avalon Rare Metals (AVL -6.4%) slump after Dahlman Rose tags the company with a...

    Shares of Avalon Rare Metals (AVL -6.4%) slump after Dahlman Rose tags the company with a downgrade to Hold from Buy. Analysts see rare earth pricing staying range bound over the next 12 to 18 months. At $1.49 a share, AVL is closing in on a 52-week low.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • RNN

    Off-radar microcap Rexahn Pharmaceuticals (NYSEMKT:RNN) is up another +16.6% today, having...

    Off-radar microcap Rexahn Pharmaceuticals (NYSEMKT:RNN) is up another +16.6% today, having doubled since Monday's announcement that it's submitted an IND application to the FDA for a first-in-human study of RX-5902 to treat advanced or metastatic solid tumors.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 3 Comments
  • XOMA

    Shares of XOMA (NASDAQ:XOMA) are active this morning, jumping +13.6% on heavy volume after a...

    Shares of XOMA (NASDAQ:XOMA) are active this morning, jumping +13.6% on heavy volume after a bullish article in Seeking Alpha said that with recent management changes the company is better positioned than anytime before to stage a comeback. In addition to new management, its key anti-inflammatory drug, Gevokizumab, is also in Phase III trials and looks very encouraging for wide array of applications.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • APKT

    Wells Fargo downgrades Acme Packet (APKT -14.8%) to Market Perform on account of its Q2 warning,...

    Wells Fargo downgrades Acme Packet (APKT -14.8%) to Market Perform on account of its Q2 warning, while lowering its valuation range to $14-$17. Near-term visibility is limited given difficult telecom capex and enterprise IT spending environments, the firm notes, and a string of warnings and downward estimate revisions is likely to pressure Acme's valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • SQNM

    Sequenom (SQNM -4.2%) sinks after a California District Court denied its petition for an...

    Sequenom (SQNM -4.2%) sinks after a California District Court denied its petition for an injunction against Ariosa Diagnostics to prevent the company from offering or selling its Harmony Prenatal Test, pending resolution of current litigation between the two companies.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • TEN

    Tenneco (TEN -3.8%) slumps after Wells Fargo ferrets out that the company won't be a supplier...

    Tenneco (TEN -3.8%) slumps after Wells Fargo ferrets out that the company won't be a supplier for the new Navistar engine.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM

  • Gold falls 1.3% to $1,588, the entirety of the decline coming in the minutes following the jobs...

    Gold falls 1.3% to $1,588, the entirety of the decline coming in the minutes following the jobs report. In a little more than a day since a gold bull's dream - 3 major central banks loosening monetary policy and weak U.S. data giving at least a bit more impetus towards further Fed ease - the metal is off 2.1%. Silver is down 4.6% during the same time frame.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 45 Comments
  • KVPBQ

    K-V Pharmaceutical (KV.A -16.8%) tanks after saying it's filed a lawsuit against the FDA for...

    K-V Pharmaceutical (KV.A -16.8%) tanks after saying it's filed a lawsuit against the FDA for failing to crack down on compounded versions of its premature birth drug Makena. Pharmacies have been using the active ingredient hydroxyprogesterone, which does not have a formal FDA clearance, to compound cheaper versions of Makena, an injectable hormonal medicine that reduces the risk of pre-term birth in pregnant women with a history of early deliveries.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • CHTP

    Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP +33%) soars today on the back of a Seeking Alpha article this morning...

    Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP +33%) soars today on the back of a Seeking Alpha article this morning that says the drug developer could see "Arena-like" gains off Northera. The stock was hit hard earlier when the FDA recommended further trials for the drug and consequently has built up a large short interest over a short period. The article says investors are ignoring the millions of dollars put into R&D on the drug, and once they realize it's undervalued, it's going be off to the races.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • JMBA

    Share of Jamba Juice (JMBA +4.8%) knock out another gain as they polish off a frothy 22% run...

    Share of Jamba Juice (JMBA +4.8%) knock out another gain as they polish off a frothy 22% run over the last 30 days. The company has reported strong sales during an excessively hot summer and has beaten back the notion that Starbucks entry into the juice business would halt growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • WLT

    Shares of Walter Energy (WLT -7.2%) are getting slammed today, after S&P cut the coal...

    Shares of Walter Energy (WLT -7.2%) are getting slammed today, after S&P cut the coal miner's already junk-level credit ratings to negative from stable on expectations that the company will post weaker-than-expected profits.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 5 Comments
  • INFA

    Companies with strong data warehousing and/or business intelligence exposure are the hardest-hit...

    Companies with strong data warehousing and/or business intelligence exposure are the hardest-hit by Informatica's (INFA -28.3%) Q2 warning. QLIK -14.4%. MSTR -10.1%. TDC -10.2%. BofA is downgrading Informatica to Underperform, and thinks the warning indicates sales execution problems, competitive pressure, and "potential structural issues in the data integration market." Jefferies is also downgrading, but only sees Informatica's problems as demand-related.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • PGHEF

    Calgary-based oil and gas producer Pengrowth Energy (PGH -4.5%) says it's cutting its monthly...

    Calgary-based oil and gas producer Pengrowth Energy (PGH -4.5%) says it's cutting its monthly dividend by 43%, partly due to ongoing commodity-price weakness. The company, which earlier this year acquired rival NAL Energy, said it will pay a monthly dividend of 4 Canadian cents as of August 15, down from 7 Canadian cents currently.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • JVA

    Coffee Holdings (JVA +6.9%) shoots higher with traders maintaining that the price action is...

    Coffee Holdings (JVA +6.9%) shoots higher with traders maintaining that the price action is reflective of the idea that it's a potentially profitable way to play Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +3.9%) due to GMCR's lower float. Whether they are right or wrong, the pair of stocks have tended to trade together over the last few months.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • TSYS

    TeleCommunication Systems (TSYS -4.6%) is acquiring microDATA GIS, a provider of next-gen 9-1-1...

    TeleCommunication Systems (TSYS -4.6%) is acquiring microDATA GIS, a provider of next-gen 9-1-1 call-management solutions, for $37M ($20M in up-front cash). TCS, whose existing E9-1-1 call-routing solutions support over half of all emergency calls, has obtained an $80M credit facility to finance the deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • NAV

    So far investors aren't buying the pitch from execs at Navistar (NYSE:NAV) that their new clean...

    So far investors aren't buying the pitch from execs at Navistar (NYSE:NAV) that their new clean engine technology is a game-changer. The company says that although it will see short term costs rise on product development, it has a stable financial position and can tap into new funds if necessary. Shares -8.2% to reach a weekly low.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • GR

    Goodrich's (GR +0.1%) Aircraft Wheels and Brakes division says it's inked a 10 year contract...

    Goodrich's (GR +0.1%) Aircraft Wheels and Brakes division says it's inked a 10 year contract extension with easyJet for the supply and maintenance of wheels and carbon brakes for their A319/A320 fleet. easyJet operates the world's largest fleet of A319/A320 aircraft with over 200 aircraft in service.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • STX

    Seagate (STX -2.4%) falls moderately, and Western Digital (WDC -0.7%) only slightly, after the...

    Seagate (STX -2.4%) falls moderately, and Western Digital (WDC -0.7%) only slightly, after the former's FQ4 warning. The companies' recent selloff, together with their low valuations, seems to be limiting downside. Baird is downgrading Seagate to Neutral, but the company has its defenders. Needham is pleased Seagate still expects its gross margin to stay above 30%. Brean Murray is comforted by Seagate's huge stock buybacks ($1.2B spent in FQ4).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • VMW

    Berenberg is downgrading VMware (VMW -6.3%) and Cognizant (CTSH -2.9%) to Hold on worries about...

    Berenberg is downgrading VMware (VMW -6.3%) and Cognizant (CTSH -2.9%) to Hold on worries about weak enterprise IT spending, particularly in Europe. Though the firm doesn't "expect a blood bath" for IT names in Q2, it thinks the odds of full-year guidance revisions are high. VMware was already pressured by Informatica's Q2 warning.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • NFLX

    The rally in shares of Netflix (NFLX +2.9%) keeps motoring right along even against a weak tape....

    The rally in shares of Netflix (NFLX +2.9%) keeps motoring right along even against a weak tape. The buying frenzy was started by a Facebook post by CEO Reed Hastings on the company's tally of streaming hours by customers, but questions on whether or not Hastings skirted SEC Regulation FD with his bravado are starting to crop up.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 3 Comments
  • DECK

    Shares of Deckers (NASDAQ:DECK) trade 2.4% lower premarket after Longbow downgrades the company...

    Shares of Deckers (NASDAQ:DECK) trade 2.4% lower premarket after Longbow downgrades the company to Neutral from Buy on concerns that European demand will worsen. The stock has also been a big target of shorts which has been affecting its price action of late.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • NS

    NuStar Energy (NYSE:NS) down 2.9% premarket after guidance that Q2 EBITDA will be "significantly...

    NuStar Energy (NYSE:NS) down 2.9% premarket after guidance that Q2 EBITDA will be "significantly lower" than the $160M in Q2 2011, due to a decline in the asphalt and fuels marketing segment and noncash charges related to selling half its asphalt operation to P-E firm Lindsay Goldberg for $175M in a joint venture.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • BOOT-OLD

    Premarket gainers: BOOT-OLD +81%. PCX +10%. JRCC +6%. Losers: INFA -30%. ALXA -11%. APKT -10%....

    Premarket gainers: BOOT-OLD +81%. PCX +10%. JRCC +6%.
    Losers: INFA -30%. ALXA -11%. APKT -10%. AONE -8%. SQNM -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • APKT

    It's early July, and the tech earnings warnings are starting to pour in. Acme Packet...

    It's early July, and the tech earnings warnings are starting to pour in. Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT) -9.5% and making multi-year lows after stating it expects Q2 revenue of $66M-$68M and EPS of $0.12-$0.13, below Street estimates of $73.9M and $0.18. As with prior warnings, the VoIP infrastructure provider blames weak sales in the North American service provider market (most likely to AT&T and/or Verizon). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • NAV

    Navistar (NYSE:NAV) announces new clean engine technology that it thinks will meet EPA emissions...

    Navistar (NYSE:NAV) announces new clean engine technology that it thinks will meet EPA emissions regulations and set it on a path to offer production-ready vehicles by early next year. Investors still need to wait until a conference call (webcast) scheduled for later this morning to see if there is more drama to come. Shares +3.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:22 AM | 3 Comments

  • Yields on Spain's 10-year bonds jump 21 bps to 6.99% as the triple-play central bank easing...

    Yields on Spain's 10-year bonds jump 21 bps to 6.99% as the triple-play central bank easing yesterday leaves markets wanting more. The surge, in addition to a 1.4% fall in the IBEX 35, comes as data shows that Spanish industrial output fell 6.1% in May, which was better than consensus of 8.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:28 AM | 3 Comments

  • EU stocks follow much of Asia and open lower, with Rabobank saying that yesterday's central bank...

    EU stocks follow much of Asia and open lower, with Rabobank saying that yesterday's central bank action raised rather than soothed fears. "Investors fretted about the possibility that these central banks know more than they do. Is the situation really that bad that they all acted together?" Euro Stoxx 50 -0.6%, London -0.2%, Paris -0.3%, Frankfurt -0.3%, Madrid -1.3%, Milan -0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 AM

  • Major Asian stock indexes have mostly fallen, with investors staying cautious following...

    Major Asian stock indexes have mostly fallen, with investors staying cautious following yesterday's central-bank ease-fest and ahead of today's U.S. nonfarm payroll data. Japan -0.7%, Hong Kong -0.2% and India -0.2%, although China +1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 AM
